reviews.text: First impression ruined. Use to frequent this location when it  was Hungry Howies and never had a bad experience. Gone are those days, it seems. Had to wait an extra hour to pick up the pizza we wanted because they had been out of the  Hot Honey sauce since that morning (we ordered in the evening) and the owner was bringing more over. Got to the store to find out that our payment, which was made online at time of order, had been canceled without our knowledge and we had to pay a second time. I had to put the pizza on a credit card since I wasn't anticipating having to pay. A heads up would have nice. And after all that, they were out of the sauce for our wings and had been since that morning according one of the guys in the back. This was also apparently hilarious as the folks in the back were all laughing about it. None of these alone are a huge problem but the whole experience was a mess from start to finish. And as of writing this, the original charge is still on my account, so there may be even more hassle yet to come. The cashier, Daryl, was polite enough and, to his credit, called after I left offering $10 off my next order. It's a hard sell, Daryl. A discount on a future headache? No thanks. First and last time I order here, which is a real shame since the pizza was tasty.

Great location very clean very nice staff. Highly recommend this pizza spot. I especially enjoy it because it's a Colorado company, that gives back to the local community. They don't see a bunch of pizzas today to the Falcon Middle School.  Blackjack rocks!

Let me just start off by saying I greatly miss Hungry Howie's...

My husband and I had never tried BlackJack Pizza before, and this will be the last time we give our business to this location in particular.

We placed an online order totalling about $49 - We paid with our debit card, and was given an estimated pick up time of 20 minutes. About 10 minutes after ordering, we get a call from a worker at this location telling us that they had run out of Mike's Hot Honey for the pizza we ordered but they had some coming in around 5:30, my husband and I were like "Yeah, that's fine, no worries, we'll come grab it at 5:30" We originally placed our order around 4:35 pm. No big deal, big kudos to the worker who called us. Then, once my husband got to the store it was all downhill from there. An older gentleman named Darryl, told us that our order needed to be paid for... ? He stated that since they ran out of hot honey, they voided the whole order... That makes absolutely no sense, since we agreed to wait to pick up the order later when the honey arrived, so my husband paid for the order again on our credit card. But, here's the kicker - the original charge DID post on our debit card, so we are out $98!!! $98!!! Outrageous!! We will be contacting our bank and putting in a fraud complaint and having them help reverse the charge. Also, they had been out of bleu cheese dipping since THAT MORNING so we had nothing for the wings we ordered. Why not let us know that on the phone when you let us know about the hot honey? Darryl had no idea what he was doing and his customer service skills are awful. My husband let him know how frustrated he was and all Darryl could say was.... Nothing.
Darryl then called my husband while he was on his way home and said that the Owner was giving us a $10 credit on our next order. My husband said "That's a hard sell, Darryl. I'm not sure about that". Darryl then responded with "Well, I did my best so I don't know what you want". Who talks to customers like that?! $10 credit on a future order that WILL NOT happen at this location ever again. What about my damn $49 I got double charged for?? Insane.

The pizza and wings were 4/5. The food is great, but not worth $98.....

I‚Äôm frustrated! I ordered my pizza ahead of time and it said my pick up time was 5:45. I got there at 5:40 and the pizza took 40 extra minutes to be ready. I was acknowledged when I walked in, but no information was given as to why it was taking so long after my pickup time. Every person who came in was being told their pizza is almost out of the oven, but we all were just waiting for a long time. The pizza tasted good, but I don‚Äôt understand how no one was getting their pizza for so long and wasn‚Äôt being told what‚Äôs going on.
Hadn't been in 27 years. Still amazing and breadsticks like no other!

recentReviews.text:
Pizza was 10/10!!!
We ordered in store and it was ready to go in 10 minutes.

Let me just start off by saying I greatly miss Hungry Howie's...

My husband and I had never tried BlackJack Pizza before, and this will be the last time we give our business to this location in particular.

We placed an online order totalling about $49 - We paid with our debit card, and was given an estimated pick up time of 20 minutes. About 10 minutes after ordering, we get a call from a worker at this location telling us that they had run out of Mike's Hot Honey for the pizza we ordered but they had some coming in around 5:30, my husband and I were like "Yeah, that's fine, no worries, we'll come grab it at 5:30" We originally placed our order around 4:35 pm. No big deal, big kudos to the worker who called us. Then, once my husband got to the store it was all downhill from there. An older gentleman named Darryl, told us that our order needed to be paid for... ? He stated that since they ran out of hot honey, they voided the whole order... That makes absolutely no sense, since we agreed to wait to pick up the order later when the honey arrived, so my husband paid for the order again on our credit card. But, here's the kicker - the original charge DID post on our debit card, so we are out $98!!! $98!!! Outrageous!! We will be contacting our bank and putting in a fraud complaint and having them help reverse the charge. Also, they had been out of bleu cheese dipping since THAT MORNING so we had nothing for the wings we ordered. Why not let us know that on the phone when you let us know about the hot honey? Darryl had no idea what he was doing and his customer service skills are awful. My husband let him know how frustrated he was and all Darryl could say was.... Nothing.
Darryl then called my husband while he was on his way home and said that the Owner was giving us a $10 credit on our next order. My husband said "That's a hard sell, Darryl. I'm not sure about that". Darryl then responded with "Well, I did my best so I don't know what you want". Who talks to customers like that?! $10 credit on a future order that WILL NOT happen at this location ever again. What about my damn $49 I got double charged for?? Insane.

The pizza and wings were 4/5. The food is great, but not worth $98.....

First impression ruined. Use to frequent this location when it  was Hungry Howies and never had a bad experience. Gone are those days, it seems. Had to wait an extra hour to pick up the pizza we wanted because they had been out of the  Hot Honey sauce since that morning (we ordered in the evening) and the owner was bringing more over. Got to the store to find out that our payment, which was made online at time of order, had been canceled without our knowledge and we had to pay a second time. I had to put the pizza on a credit card since I wasn't anticipating having to pay. A heads up would have nice. And after all that, they were out of the sauce for our wings and had been since that morning according one of the guys in the back. This was also apparently hilarious as the folks in the back were all laughing about it. None of these alone are a huge problem but the whole experience was a mess from start to finish. And as of writing this, the original charge is still on my account, so there may be even more hassle yet to come. The cashier, Daryl, was polite enough and, to his credit, called after I left offering $10 off my next order. It's a hard sell, Daryl. A discount on a future headache? No thanks. First and last time I order here, which is a real shame since the pizza was tasty.

This place started out pretty good when they opened and now is starting to go downhill‚Ä¶my last two carry out orders were so late, I decided to cancel them. Going to give this location a break for awhile‚Ä¶please do better!

I called spoke to the owner Tiffany and complained.  She in her own words basically called me a liar.  That is not right.  When someone has a legit complaint you should be heard.  As for Ms. Tiffany you could not speak as she herself believes she is better then us all.  PLEASE GO SOMEWHERE ELSE AND NOT SUPPORT SUCH A BEHAVIOR OR THIS COMPANY AT ALL.

Arrived 15mins after food notification was ready. When we arrived one guy told me ten more minutes. I came back after ten and they said they were still waiting on the calzone (my order was two calzones, gluten free pizza and breadsticks) to which someone else came up asking what my order was...he spent some time and didnt seem to know what I was talking about ans said yeah it'll be out soon. 30 more mins went by of the workers banging around and making Epstein jokes. I watched them set all sorts of orders down but no one said a word till a girl came up and finally found them set down and forgotten about. I love the food here but the atmosphere was so noisy I had to yell and waiting too long in a noisy lobby, least the food was fresh and tasted well.

detailedReviews.author: Megan Bordelon
detailedReviews.text:
Pizza was 10/10!!!
We ordered in store and it was ready to go in 10 minutes.

detailedReviews.author: Brittney Wright
detailedReviews.text: Super good pizza!

detailedReviews.author: Mary Blair
detailedReviews.text:

detailedReviews.text: First impression ruined. Use to frequent this location when it  was Hungry Howies and never had a bad experience. Gone are those days, it seems. Had to wait an extra hour to pick up the pizza we wanted because they had been out of the  Hot Honey sauce since that morning (we ordered in the evening) and the owner was bringing more over. Got to the store to find out that our payment, which was made online at time of order, had been canceled without our knowledge and we had to pay a second time. I had to put the pizza on a credit card since I wasn't anticipating having to pay. A heads up would have nice. And after all that, they were out of the sauce for our wings and had been since that morning according one of the guys in the back. This was also apparently hilarious as the folks in the back were all laughing about it. None of these alone are a huge problem but the whole experience was a mess from start to finish. And as of writing this, the original charge is still on my account, so there may be even more hassle yet to come. First and last time I order here, which is a real shame since the pizza was tasty.

detailedReviews.author: RS NATION
detailedReviews.text: This place started out pretty good when they opened and now is starting to go downhill‚Ä¶my last two carry out orders were so late, I decided to cancel them. Going to give this location a break for awhile‚Ä¶please do better!

detailedReviews.author: Tire Shop
detailedReviews.text: I called spoke to the owner Tiffany and complained.  She in her own words basically called me a liar.  That is not right.  When someone has a legit complaint you should be heard.  As for Ms. Tiffany you could not speak as she herself believes she is better then us all.  PLEASE GO SOMEWHERE ELSE AND NOT SUPPORT SUCH A BEHAVIOR OR THIS COMPANY AT ALL.

detailedReviews.author: Nikki Scott
detailedReviews.text: Arrived 15mins after food notification was ready. When we arrived one guy told me ten more minutes. I came back after ten and they said they were still waiting on the calzone (my order was two calzones, gluten free pizza and breadsticks) to which someone else came up asking what my order was...he spent some time and didnt seem to know what I was talking about ans said yeah it'll be out soon. 30 more mins went by of the workers banging around and making Epstein jokes. I watched them set all sorts of orders down but no one said a word till a girl came up and finally found them set down and forgotten about. I love the food here but the atmosphere was so noisy I had to yell and waiting too long in a noisy lobby, least the food was fresh and tasted well.

detailedReviews.author: Greg Kimble
detailedReviews.text: Today my calzone came out of the oven like I made it myself. Not bready or doughy plenty of ingredients without overkill, and the perfect crunch on top! Friendly, fast service with a great location.

detailedReviews.author: Taylor Fhuere
detailedReviews.text:
Almost 2 hours to deliver a couple of C- pizzas. To no one‚Äôs surprise the pizzas were obviously cold by the time they got to our house, and the manager himself let me know he was the one that forgot all of the sauces. Called the store & asked what‚Äôs going on, the first girl that answered was nice and apologized and offered to refund, only to have her rude/nasty manager take the phone from her and tell me yeah we‚Äôre not doing that & wished me good luck moving forward.

Hope that was worth the dispute that we‚Äôll be filing with our bank to reverse the charges. You sure got me, man!

Edit to response below:

Future customers, be advised a 13 minute drive is out of their delivery range and if you say 1 cuss word after getting cold food delivered an hour and a half after their quoted delivery time you will receive poor customer service. Would also think it would be understandable to be frustrated after 1 nice employee does the right thing and offers to comp the order, only to have her manager say in the background ‚Äúyeah we‚Äôre not doing that‚Äù and steal the phone from her. Don‚Äôt expect accountability, efficiency or friendly people here.

detailedReviews.author: Holden Udell
detailedReviews.text: I‚Äôm frustrated! I ordered my pizza ahead of time and it said my pick up time was 5:45. I got there at 5:40 and the pizza took 40 extra minutes to be ready. I was acknowledged when I walked in, but no information was given as to why it was taking so long after my pickup time. Every person who came in was being told their pizza is almost out of the oven, but we all were just waiting for a long time. The pizza tasted good, but I don‚Äôt understand how no one was getting their pizza for so long and wasn‚Äôt being told what‚Äôs going on.

detailedReviews.author: Tinker
detailedReviews.text: Additives in pizza , definitely not full yeast pizza - if your immune compromised at all i suggest joeys pizza or slice 420 , this place will oeave you hurting with stomach ache and a headache that lasts two days

detailedReviews.author: Dan L
detailedReviews.text: Literally the worst pizza I have EVER had. Mostly burnt dough bubbles.

detailedReviews.author: Rhonda Davis
detailedReviews.text: Excellent pizza and salad

detailedReviews.author: Flash150
detailedReviews.text: Not bad

detailedReviews.author: ACM Rants
detailedReviews.text: One of our go-tos for take out pizza.  They have a great cherry walnut salad, also.

detailedReviews.author: Heiko Schwarz
detailedReviews.text: Decent pizza. Quality ingredients. I'll order from here again.

detailedReviews.author: Valerie Chevalier
detailedReviews.text: Placed online order and message said pizza would be ready in 20 minutes. I get there and I‚Äôm asked to come back in another 20 because they were behind. 45 minutes and $34 later I get the pizzas home to see both were burnt. We were hungry after having a long day so we ate it but didn‚Äôt enjoy it. I called the location and the lady who answered the phone said ‚Äúblack jacks sorry we‚Äôre closed‚Äù. I explained my disappointment and I heard nothing then a manager introduced himself. I re-explained my disappointment and said I likely would not return unless they could do something. The manager hung up on me. My family will NEVER return! Plenty of other places to get better pizza. Thanks for nothing Black Jack

detailedReviews.author: B J
detailedReviews.text: Kind of a long wait when they were not even busy. I got 6 wings instead of 8 wings so someone oopsed on their counting ability. They did not get the crust right on one of my pizzas. I asked for thin and got some fat bready crust. The other pizza I asked for no red sauce and to use olive oil and garlic sauce instead and extra cheese. What i got was a pizza with red sauce, not a whole lot of cheese, with minced garlic on top of the cheese like it was a topping rather than the sauce base and a drizzle of olive oil over the top of that as well. It was a "what the heck is this?!" moment. The staff were nice but Nothing done to fix the order. My next order they finally got the crust type right but it was very hard and hard to chew and hardly any feta when I asked for extra. This location is a letdown so far. They need to reopen Tutt location and/pr retrain their staff here. Blackjack used to be the star of the pizza game in all of Colorado. Now, it is lacking, lacking, lacking. I'd rather spend the $24 on one pizza at a large retail chain like Domino's instead of here. I never thought I'd say that! I'll still give them a try every now and then, but if this keeps going like it is, they'll lose a lot of business. I want them to succeed but this isn't going to accomplish that at the moment. Please keep trying though Blackjack... I've got my fingers crossed for you.

detailedReviews.author: Angel
detailedReviews.text: Super nice staff !

detailedReviews.author: Marie Sanchez
detailedReviews.text: Great customer service Brooklen was so helpful and she helped me with all the questions I had and when I got to the store it was very clean and I was greated once u walked in I also added a additional item to my order and she was happy to help all around . I will always come to this location no matter how far just because all staff was great and they actually care about there customers thank you Brooklen for the great service

detailedReviews.author: steffan petrocelli
detailedReviews.text: So stoked we got a BlackJack nearby! Way better than any other delivery around here, especially at the price. Drivers are always friendly (and not sub contracted to uber / door dash thankfully). I hope business is great so we can keep you guys around!

detailedReviews.author: Dylan Clarke
detailedReviews.text: Good people. Good food. Family owned and run and they actually care about you.

detailedReviews.author: Shayna B
detailedReviews.text: Hadn't been in 27 years. Still amazing and breadsticks like no other!

detailedReviews.author: Mike Crook
detailedReviews.text: Other than the delivery being much later than promised everything was great!

detailedReviews.author: Marianne May
detailedReviews.text: Small and clean place. Friendly  staff. Pizza was very good. I would order here again.

detailedReviews.author: Ronald Burdette
detailedReviews.text: Great location very clean very nice staff. Highly recommend this pizza spot. I especially enjoy it because it's a Colorado company, that gives back to the local community. They don't see a bunch of pizzas today to the Falcon Middle School.  Blackjack rocks!

detailedReviews.author: Don Kilo
detailedReviews.text:
Look at this abomination.

At this poin I just want my money back

detailedReviews.author: Noah
detailedReviews.text: Very nice staff and delicious pizza! The sante fe was amazing!

detailedReviews.author: April Blake
detailedReviews.text: I ordered ahead of time and still waited close to an hour. They are so unorganized. A guy came in after me waited about 15 minutes and his pizza was sitting there the whole time but the guy up front wasn't reading the labels. Once my pizza was ready I waited another 15 minutes for a salad. Several customers were ignored as well.

detailedReviews.author: Monica Long
detailedReviews.text: I love Black Jack, but this location could use improvement in their pizza preparation. The ingredients were fresh and tasted great but were overwhelmed by the amount of sauce, soo much sauce that the cheese (which was more concentrated towards the center) didn't stick and slid off. The pizza also wasn't cut all the way through, no biggie if you have a pizza cutter at home.

detailedReviews.author: Vince Woodson
detailedReviews.text: One of the best pizzas in town for the cost!

detailedReviews.author: John Walker
detailedReviews.text: This manager could not handle a simple complaint because THEY did not bring us our full order.. we did not receive all the food we ordered .. now they will not deliver to us. As a business owner myself I am absolutely shocked at this behavior ! We were not rude ,  just stated the facts .. instead of trying to be better they decided they don‚Äôt want our future business. Very spiteful and immature.. plenty of other pizza out there .. but how pathetic she is very sad ! Horrible manager

detailedReviews.author: ADRIAN NOLASCO
detailedReviews.text: Glad Blackjack‚Äôs is back on our part of town. Pizza is always great and service is too!

detailedReviews.author: xvInoahIvx
detailedReviews.text: Love Blackjacks

detailedReviews.author: jenna scherbenske
detailedReviews.text: Terrible customer service! We placed an order for delivery and was told it would take 45 min to an hour. 1.5 hours later I call to check on the order since it hadn‚Äôt come yet and was told the driver had just left. 30 more minutes go by and so I call again and they tell me someone in the store had messed up and marked our order as carry out. Mistakes happen of course but they handled it terribly‚Ä¶they refused to refund our order and wouldn‚Äôt send it out, said we had to come get it about 2 hours after we had placed our order. Never ordering from here again

detailedReviews.author: Ashley Prentice
detailedReviews.text: Every time I have called no one has answered the phone and today I tried to go there and the sign said open but the door was locked!

detailedReviews.author: Lowell Lucas Jr.
detailedReviews.text:
There's been some questionable service at blackjack lately.
A couple of days ago, I was tired after working a 9 hour shift ( with no lunch break)and really had a hankering for a good meal. I contacted blackjack and wanted to get the specialty pizza deal with 1 free 1-topping pizza. However, i had to go through a series of questions until my deal was accepted...and had to have said coupon to get it. I went ahead and went along with it since the coupons available at King Soopers, but was a little irritated that I had to wait even longer to get my meal. So when I arrived back at the store with the coupon in hand I wanted to speak with a manager about the situation. No one grabbed a manager, but the employee , who handled my order, came over to see what the problem was. I explained my situation and even said I'm paying a little bit more than I was intending to just to get my order. I asked if I had to use a keyword, in the future, or if there's something I need to say in order to avoid this situation. She said "Yeah just tell us the key word next time." I explained that's what I did the first time and I'm still here. Is there anything you can do to make this right? She looked at me puzzled and angry, stating "What else can I help you with?" Trying to change the subject. At that point I was like "Can't you do something to make the situation right?" She asked me "What would you want me to do?" At that point, I shared what do you think would make this right? Eventually a man who appeared( whom I'd assume is the manager) said he was just going to honor the coupon and have my order done. Looking annoyed he shared it's not worth arguing over a pizza. All I wanted was an apology, but at this point, I knew that wasn't going to happen. When they looked at me, after I got my pizzas, they gave me this ugly stare and gave off a feeling like I was a nuisance and clearly wanted me out of the store.  They asked was there anything else I wanted? And I just answered " Yes, I requested napkins and paper plates for my order."The manager grabbed them and sarcastically dropped them on my pizza boxes. I felt like, damn I've been ordering at this location for over 10 years now and I've never been treated this badly. I really hope none of you ever go through what I went through for my order. It wasn't the best treatment I received customer service wise, and it looks like they'd rather have you in/ out of their store then wanting to help you.

detailedReviews.author: Monty Brickell
detailedReviews.text: We've been ordering pizza here for 15 years, actually it's the only kind of pizza my daughter will eat.

detailedReviews.author: Lacey Anderson
detailedReviews.text: I ordered take out yesterday, 01/06. It was delicious. Good amount of toppings, had light sauce like I requested and it wasn‚Äôt very greasy. Super friendly staff. The store was clean. I‚Äôll gladly drive to this location from Fountain, anytime!

detailedReviews.author: Amy Dunn
detailedReviews.text: This is one of the best pizzas around!

detailedReviews.author: Matthew Trimpey
detailedReviews.text: Burned, slices not cut through, Too much bread not enough substance. I would avoid.

detailedReviews.author: Justin Saunders
detailedReviews.text: The large pan was delicious. Ample toppings, tasty sauce. Very similar to Detroit style but just a little different. Very friendly staff. Highly recommend.

detailedReviews.author: Jessica Ford
detailedReviews.text: The staff are super friendly and the pizza is delicious! Highly recommended!

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customer opinions are divided. The 3.6/5 rating from 56 recent reviews suggests some great experiences mixed with areas needing attention.

strengthsPerceived: Customers love the fast service, with orders ready in just 10 minutes, making it a perfect choice for quick takeout. - Boostly marketing services can amplify this

The friendly and helpful staff, particularly highlighted by specific mentions of employees like Brooklen, make the customer experience memorable and welcoming. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
The use of quality ingredients and the perfect preparation of items like calzones and salads are consistently praised by customers. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
improvementOpportunities: Double charging and payment issues - review management can address this concern
Long wait times and disorganized service - Boostly marketing services can improve this
Negative customer service experiences - social media marketing can improve this area

positive.author: Megan Bordelon
positive.text:
Pizza was 10/10!!!
We ordered in store and it was ready to go in 10 minutes.

neutral.author: RS NATION
neutral.text: This place started out pretty good when they opened and now is starting to go downhill‚Ä¶my last two carry out orders were so late, I decided to cancel them. Going to give this location a break for awhile‚Ä¶please do better!

I asked for thin and got some fat bready crust. The other pizza I asked for no red sauce and to use olive oil and garlic sauce instead and extra cheese. What i got was a pizza with red sauce, not a whole lot of cheese, with minced garlic on top of the cheese like it was a topping rather than the sauce base and a drizzle of olive oil over the top of that as well. It was a "what the heck is this?!" moment. The staff were nice but Nothing done to fix the order. My next order they finally got the crust type right but it was very hard and hard to chew and hardly any feta when I asked for extra. This location is a letdown so far. They need to reopen Tutt location and/pr retrain their staff here. Blackjack used to be the star of the pizza game in all of Colorado. Now, it is lacking, lacking, lacking. I'd rather spend the $24 on one pizza at a large retail chain like Domino's instead of here. I never thought I'd say that! I'll still give them a try every now and then, but if this keeps going like it is, they'll lose a lot of business. I want them to succeed but this isn't going to accomplish that at the moment. Please keep trying though Blackjack... I've got my fingers crossed for you.

negative.author: Mary Blair
negative.text:
Let me just start off by saying I greatly miss Hungry Howie's...

My husband and I had never tried BlackJack Pizza before, and this will be the last time we give our business to this location in particular.

We placed an online order totalling about $49 - We paid with our debit card, and was given an estimated pick up time of 20 minutes. About 10 minutes after ordering, we get a call from a worker at this location telling us that they had run out of Mike's Hot Honey for the pizza we ordered but they had some coming in around 5:30, my husband and I were like "Yeah, that's fine, no worries, we'll come grab it at 5:30" We originally placed our order around 4:35 pm. No big deal, big kudos to the worker who called us. Then, once my husband got to the store it was all downhill from there. An older gentleman named Darryl, told us that our order needed to be paid for... ? He stated that since they ran out of hot honey, they voided the whole order... That makes absolutely no sense, since we agreed to wait to pick up the order later when the honey arrived, so my husband paid for the order again on our credit card. But, here's the kicker - the original charge DID post on our debit card, so we are out $98!!! $98!!! Outrageous!! We will be contacting our bank and putting in a fraud complaint and having them help reverse the charge. Also, they had been out of bleu cheese dipping since THAT MORNING so we had nothing for the wings we ordered. Why not let us know that on the phone when you let us know about the hot honey? Darryl had no idea what he was doing and his customer service skills are awful. My husband let him know how frustrated he was and all Darryl could say was.... Nothing.
Darryl then called my husband while he was on his way home and said that the Owner was giving us a $10 credit on our next order. My husband said "That's a hard sell, Darryl. I'm not sure about that". Darryl then responded with "Well, I did my best so I don't know what you want". Who talks to customers like that?! $10 credit on a future order that WILL NOT happen at this location ever again. What about my damn $49 I got double charged for?? Insane.

The pizza and wings were 4/5. The food is great, but not worth $98.....

negative.author: Sean Patrick
negative.text: First impression ruined. Use to frequent this location when it  was Hungry Howies and never had a bad experience. Gone are those days, it seems. Had to wait an extra hour to pick up the pizza we wanted because they had been out of the  Hot Honey sauce since that morning (we ordered in the evening) and the owner was bringing more over. Got to the store to find out that our payment, which was made online at time of order, had been canceled without our knowledge and we had to pay a second time. I had to put the pizza on a credit card since I wasn't anticipating having to pay. A heads up would have nice. And after all that, they were out of the sauce for our wings and had been since that morning according one of the guys in the back. This was also apparently hilarious as the folks in the back were all laughing about it. None of these alone are a huge problem but the whole experience was a mess from start to finish. And as of writing this, the original charge is still on my account, so there may be even more hassle yet to come. The cashier, Daryl, was polite enough and, to his credit, called after I left offering $10 off my next order. It's a hard sell, Daryl. A discount on a future headache? No thanks. First and last time I order here, which is a real shame since the pizza was tasty.

negative.author: Tire Shop
negative.text: I called spoke to the owner Tiffany and complained.  She in her own words basically called me a liar.  That is not right.  When someone has a legit complaint you should be heard.  As for Ms. Tiffany you could not speak as she herself believes she is better then us all.  PLEASE GO SOMEWHERE ELSE AND NOT SUPPORT SUCH A BEHAVIOR OR THIS COMPANY AT ALL.
